chunks.chunk_text: 每週三來到Fifteen Minute Cafe英語咖啡館喝一杯老師們的本週主題特調一起探討國際文化、時事、GI、網路和音樂等多元主題輕鬆吸收主題相關的詞彙慣用語和常用粒句大家好我是簡詩明你也可以叫我耀里詩詩我是一位藥師絕世歌手Podcaster同時在廣播節目主持兩個節目健康節目跟音樂節目哦好了我們趕快把時間交還給詹老師

chunks.chunk_text: Perhaps they'll listen now.So those are the two verses.You see, my verse is about the flowers, trees and color, right?Rifical parts.A lot of color and then your verse is more like listen, sanity.Let's start.That's with the first verse, right?Paint your palette blue and gray.So what is the key word palette here?Palette means the colorful palette, okay?When you start painting, let's say oil paint.

chunks.chunk_text: You will get little tubes of paint.And you would have them on your little tray.And then on your little tray, you would dab.You would dab a little color here, dab a little color there.And then after about 10, 20 colors, you will see on your tray is a palette of colors.Different colors, right?You got blue, dark blue, light blue, yellow blue, green blue, and then all the yellows that are in different colors.

chunks.chunk_text: So for ladies, your makeup is also called a palette.Oh, right.Now you get it, right?Little blocks of different colors.That is a palette.So paint your palette blue and gray, right?So that is the Van Gogh color.So starry starry night, it's a little blue and gray.Yes, yes.Okay.It's not bright, sort of a little dark.Here he said the next line.

chunks.chunk_text: Summer's day with eyes that know the darkness in my soul.If you think about that line, what does that line mean?That is the feeling of Van Gogh.What did Van Gogh do?When he looked out, okay, this is written in a perspective of Van Gogh.Van Gogh, remember he went crazy and he was locked up in a Salem, okay?Which is a crazy house, right?You lock people in a sanatorium.

chunks.chunk_text: And so out of the window of the sanitarium, what did he see?That's what he saw.The lyrics.So that's why he says look out on a summer's day with eyes that know the darkness in my soul.Why?Because he went crazy.He had some sort of mental illness.Through the beautiful painting, the sky.So it's written from Van Gogh's perspective.

chunks.chunk_text: So this first verse is talking about, okay, now Van Gogh, from his point of view, at that period in his life, he was not good.He had darkness in his soul.But he kept on painting.Blue and gray.He painted, sketched the trees and the daffodils.And then he also had colors on the snowy linen land.

chunks.chunk_text: And then we go back to your verse.Now I understand what you tried to say to me.How you suffered for your sanity.How you tried to set them free.They would not listen.They did not know.Perhaps they will listen now.This verse is not from Van Gogh's perspective.This verse is from the listener's perspective.From the people now today, we see Van Gogh's brilliant paintings.We understand now what he's trying to say.

chunks.chunk_text: Please help.He's calling for help.But who's not listen?You see, he told people he needs help.And they would not listen.They didn't understand how to help him.He couldn't say it in his era.He couldn't tell people, hey, I just need some medicine.I just need some time to calm me down and I'll be okay.But no, they treated him like a madman.So he didn't go crazy.He didn't become a madman.It was very unfortunate he had some mental illness.

chunks.chunk_text: That he had to deal with.And that's why the verse ended.Perhaps they will listen now.Today, modern times, modern science, we understand mental illness better.So unfortunately, back in Van Gogh days, no, he was a crazy man.How sad.People thought he's crazy.Yes, but he was just trying to get rid of his crazy through his artwork.That was the only thing that healed him, his artwork.

chunks.chunk_text: help us understand things better.Yes.Yes.We sometimes can't help it.It's not your fault.It's part of a DNA.Or it's part of something that happened to you.Or you got bumped in the head.So the next verse is here.For they could not love you.But still your love was true.And when no hope was left inside on that starry starry night.You see.Nobody could love you then.Nobody understood you then.And your love was still true.To the art.Yes.Yes.

chunks.chunk_text: He was still staying true to his art.He kept painting.He didn't give up.Never.When no hope was left inside that starry starry night.So maybe on that starry starry night.He was painting for hope.Even at that time when he didn't feel any hope.He kept painting.The next part.I think this is more like Don McLean to Van Gogh.From one artist to another.So the next verse is you took your life as lovers often do.

chunks.chunk_text: And half a century gone.The reason why I mentioned the album's name is American Pie.Also another big hit from Don McLean.And often used in other musics today.For a lot of song.American Pie and Starry Starry Night.Which was a song written for Vincent Van Gogh.Oh.And I love you so.That song.I think that's from Don McLean too.Yes.Big hit.So these songs from his album American Pie.

chunks.chunk_text: Big big big hits.Until today.We still listen to them.And we still hear.And singing classes use them as singing practices.In my childhood growing up.In primary school.In our singing class.We used to sing American Pie.Oh really.And we used to sing Starry Starry Night.I don't know that.Wow.Wow.And we sang the Beatles.And then we sang all the golden oldies.Because our singing teacher loved these golden oldies.

chunks.chunk_text: 然後我去了奧馬斯丹,墨西哥博物館我也去了,所以我喜歡他們!好,你也很喜歡!是的,是的,我也是!我看到了墨西哥博物館在國家歷史博物館附近台北大站我去那間博物館,那是我第一次去那裡我不是很大意見藝術的人我去那裡,然後我心想,我的天啊

chunks.chunk_text: 我不懂藝術但是我感覺到我看到了墨西哥博物館的時候我必須說,我看到了墨西哥博物館的時候我感覺到很放鬆,因為某些奇怪的原因可能我年紀太大了,我才能理解墨西哥博物館然後我去那裡,我讀了他的故事,然後我心想,這是個瘋狂的男人!是,是!我看到了幾個他的作品,然後我心想,他們很酷,但是我不懂所以我走掉了

chunks.chunk_text: 只有之後,我看到了Mone,我心想,OK,我不知道為什麼我感覺到某些東西!是的,Mone,那是很美麗的!有些藝術作品有些力量,它會打擊你的,所以,很可惜,我去到博物館的時候,它並沒有打擊我,但Mone沒有但我現在不能說,現在我知道這首歌了,可能我去那裡,我會唱這首歌是的,因為在那些顏色背後,你能感受到他在爭執中的感覺

chunks.chunk_text: 在我們中學生高學的課程中我們在那裡學習了然後人們會覺得那是醜的畫如果你不知道怎麼畫它就像是醜的畫對所以我想說的是人們必須感覺到生活的困難我認為每個人都需要去經歷一些東西如果你是在壞的年代你必須去
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins英語咖啡館 Ep.200_ 爵士學英語 _滿天星空的文森 Don Mcleans Starry Starry Night.json

chunks.chunk_text: 你必須去經歷它你只要去看它它會殺死你它可以有其他方式去變得更好你不要去做它你不要去做它這是我認為的一件事我們學到了的我認為在這裡的總結上是你可能今天在面對困難你可能今天在面對一些壓迫的事情你不必擔心它會走掉的只是時間的問題它不殺你會讓你更強壯我喜歡這個
